org.strongback.components

Interface TalonSRX

  • All Superinterfaces:
    LimitedMotor, Motor, Requirable, SpeedController, SpeedSensor, Stoppable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    TalonController

    @Experimental
public interface TalonSRX
extends LimitedMotor
    A motor controlled by a Talon SRX with built-in current sensor, position (angle) sensor, and optional external limit switches wired into the SRX so that it can automatically stop the forward and reverse directions when the limit switches are triggered.

    This class is currently experimental. It certainly works as a simple motor, but most of this interface exposes functionality of the Talon SRX motor controller, including various input sensors. Little beyond setting and reading the speed has been tested.

      • reverseSensor

        TalonSRX reverseSensor(boolean flip)
        Flips the sign (multiplies by negative one) the feedback device values read by the Talon.

        This only affects position and velocity closed loop control. Allows for situations where you may have a sensor flipped and going in the wrong direction.

        Parameters:
        flip - true if sensor input should be flipped, or false if not.
        Returns:
        this object so that methods can be chained; never null

      • setForwardSoftLimit

        TalonSRX setForwardSoftLimit(int forwardLimitInDegrees)
        Set the soft limit for the forward throttle, in terms of the angle as measured by the selected input sensor. Soft limits can be used to disable motor drive when the "Sensor Position" is outside of a specified range: forward throttle will be disabled if the "Sensor Position" is greater than the forward soft limit. This takes effect only when the forward soft limit is enableForwardSoftLimit(boolean).

        Soft limits can be used to disable motor drive when the “Sensor Position” is outside of a specified range. Forward throttle will be disabled if the “Sensor Position” is greater than the Forward Soft Limit. Reverse throttle will be disabled if the “Sensor Position” is less than the Reverse Soft Limit. The respective Soft Limit Enable must be enabled for this feature to take effect.

        Parameters:
        forwardLimitInDegrees - the angle at which the forward throttle should be disabled, where the angle in terms of the getSelectedSensor()
        Returns:
        this object so that methods can be chained; never null
        See Also:
        enableForwardSoftLimit(boolean)

      • setReverseSoftLimit

        TalonSRX setReverseSoftLimit(int reverseLimitInDegrees)
        Set the soft limit for the reverse throttle, in terms of the angle as measured by the selected input sensor. Soft limits can be used to disable motor drive when the "Sensor Position" it outside of a specified range: reverse throttle will be disabled if the "Sensor Position" is less than the reverse soft limit. This takes effect only when the reverse soft limit is enableReverseSoftLimit(boolean).

        Soft limits can be used to disable motor drive when the “Sensor Position” is outside of a specified range. Forward throttle will be disabled if the “Sensor Position” is greater than the Forward Soft Limit. Reverse throttle will be disabled if the “Sensor Position” is less than the Reverse Soft Limit. The respective Soft Limit Enable must be enabled for this feature to take effect.

        Parameters:
        reverseLimitInDegrees - the angle at which the reverse throttle should be disabled, where the angle in terms of the getSelectedSensor()
        Returns:
        this object so that methods can be chained; never null
        See Also:
        enableForwardSoftLimit(boolean)

      • enableForwardSoftLimit

        TalonSRX enableForwardSoftLimit(boolean enable)
        Enable the soft limit for forward throttle, which is set via the setForwardSoftLimit(int).
        Parameters:
        enable - true if the forward throttle soft limit should be enabled
        Returns:
        this object so that methods can be chained; never null
        See Also:
        setForwardLimitSwitchNormallyOpen(boolean)

      • enableLimitSwitch

        TalonSRX enableLimitSwitch(boolean forward,
                           boolean reverse)
        Enable the forward and reverse limit switches.
        Parameters:
        forward - true if the forward limit is to be enabled, or false otherwise
        reverse - true if the reverse limit is to be enabled, or false otherwise
        Returns:
        this object so that methods can be chained; never null

      • setForwardLimitSwitchNormallyOpen

        TalonSRX setForwardLimitSwitchNormallyOpen(boolean normallyOpen)
        Configure the forward limit switch to be normally open or normally closed. Talon will disable momentarily if the Talon's current setting is dissimilar to the caller's requested setting. Since Talon saves setting to flash this should only affect a given Talon initially during robot install.
        Parameters:
        normallyOpen - true for normally open, or false for normally closed.
        Returns:
        this object so that methods can be chained; never null

      • setReverseLimitSwitchNormallyOpen

        TalonSRX setReverseLimitSwitchNormallyOpen(boolean normallyOpen)
        Configure the reverse limit switch to be normally open or normally closed. Talon will disable momentarily if the Talon's current setting is dissimilar to the caller's requested setting. Since Talon saves setting to flash this should only affect a given Talon initially during robot install.
        Parameters:
        normallyOpen - true for normally open, or false for normally closed.
        Returns:
        this object so that methods can be chained; never null

      • enableBrakeMode

        TalonSRX enableBrakeMode(boolean brake)
        Enable the brake mode.
        Parameters:
        brake - true if the brake mode is to be enabled, or false otherwise
        Returns:
        this object so that methods can be chained; never null

      • setVoltageRampRate

        TalonSRX setVoltageRampRate(double rampRate)
        The Talon SRX can be set to honor a ramp rate to prevent instantaneous changes in throttle. This ramp rate is in effect regardless of which mode is selected (throttle, slave, or closed-loop). For example, setting the ramp rate to 6.0 will limit the maximum voltage change within any second to be less than or equal to 6.0 volts.
        Parameters:
        rampRate - maximum change in voltage per second, in volts / second
        Returns:
        this object so that methods can be chained; never null

      • faults

        TalonSRX.Faults faults()
        Get the faults currently associated with the Talon controller. These state of these faults may change at any time based upon the state of the module, and so they cannot be manually cleared.
        Returns:
        the current faults; never null
        See Also:
        stickyFaults()

      • stickyFaults

        TalonSRX.Faults stickyFaults()
        Get the sticky faults associated with the Talon controller. Once these faults are triggered, they are only reset with #clearStickyFaults
        Returns:
        the sticky faults; never null
        See Also:
        faults(), clearStickyFaults()

        Clear all sticky faults that may have been triggered.
        Returns:
        this instance so that methods can be chained; never null

      • getFirmwareVersion

        long getFirmwareVersion()
        Get the firmware version.
        Returns:
        the version of the firmware running on the Talon

      • isSafetyEnabled

        boolean isSafetyEnabled()
        Determine whether this motor controller's safety mode is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if the motor will be automatically disabled if it is not used within the expiration time, or false otherwise

      • setSafetyEnabled

        TalonSRX setSafetyEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Set whether this motor controller's safety mode is enabled.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if the motor will be automatically disabled if it is not used within the expiration time, or false otherwise
        Returns:
        this instance so that methods can be chained; never null

      • getExpiration

        double getExpiration()
        Get the motor safety expiration time in milliseconds. When safety is enabled, then the motor will be automatically disabled if it is not used within the expiration time, which is typically 100ms. This can be adjusted to a larger value when debugging the robot.
        Returns:
        the safety expiration time in milliseconds

      • setExpiration

        TalonSRX setExpiration(double timeout)
        Set the motor safety expiration time in milliseconds. When safety is enabled, then the motor will be automatically disabled if it is not used within the expiration time, which is typically 100ms. This can be adjusted to a larger value when debugging the robot.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the safety expiration time in milliseconds
        Returns:
        this instance so that methods can be chained; never null

      • isAlive

        boolean isAlive()
        Determine if this motor controller is alive or has been disabled because it has not been used within the expiration.
        Returns:
        true if the controller is alive, or false if it has been disabled after expiring.
